meanings.definition: To jointly insure with another or others.
meanings.sent1: My friend and I coinsure our car to save money on insurance.
meanings.sent2: The siblings decided to coinsure their new house to protect their investment.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors coinsure their community garden against unpredictable weather.
meanings.sent4: We coinsure our business, ensuring that any losses are shared equally.
meanings.sent5: Coinsuring our belongings gives us peace of mind in case of any accidents.

meanings.sent1: Let's coinsure our pets to make sure they are covered in case of illness.
meanings.sent2: The couple coinsured their jewelry collection for added protection.
meanings.sent3: They decided to coinsure their antique furniture, just in case of any mishaps.
meanings.sent4: Coinsuring our travel plans ensures we are both protected during our trip.
meanings.sent5: Coinsuring our valuable items is a smart way to safeguard our possessions.

meanings.definition: To share the risk of loss.
meanings.sent1: By coinsuring our crops, we reduce the financial burden in case of a bad harvest.
meanings.sent2: The group of farmers coinsured their livestock to protect against unforeseen events.
meanings.sent3: Coinsuring our equipment helps us all feel more secure about our farming business.
meanings.sent4: Coinsuring our properties allows us to support each other in times of need.
meanings.sent5: Coinsuring our crops ensures that no one bears the loss alone.
